value: Dax Versus the Gremlins
Learn to set goals and stay on track.
20 to 30 minutes
To unlock this mission:
Add at least 1 goal to your profile

Let's Go!
How to Set Goals
How to Set Goals
See how Dax learns to set goals.
How to Set Goals
See how Dax learns to set goals.
Music is from Bendsound.com

“They watched in horror as the doorknob slowly began to turn—”<hr/>BEEP BEEP BEEP! The sound of Dax’s stopwatch trilled, interrupting her story.<hr/>“Gotta go!” Dax was off in a flash, running towards the park. Marsh and Pep were left sitting on the bench staring after her, stunned by her sudden exit.

“What’s the rush?” Marsh asked finally, annoyed by the abrupt ending to the scary story.<hr/>“Cartwheel practice!” remembered Pep. “Dax is trying to learn to do a perfect cartwheel.”<hr/>Pep knew how badly Dax wanted to compete in the Olympics one day. “Learning to cartwheel is a key skill for a gymnast, so it's a really important goal.”

Suddenly Pep jumped up, pointing in Dax's direction. “Do you see that? I think Dax is being followed!”<hr/>Marsh shrugged. “It just looks like clouds of dust to me.”<hr/>But Pep knew better. <hr/>“Clean your glasses, Marsh. That’s a whole grapple of goal gremlins!”

Marsh blinked at Pep. “Goal gremlins? A grapple? Please explain.”<hr/>Pep told Marsh how goal gremlins are tricksters who want to derail anyone working to meet a goal. They can appear in many forms and are hard to spot. But when you do spot them they lose a lot of their power.”

Pep suspected that the first gremlin to go after Dax would be the Muddler.
“This gremlin likes to strike early, when a goal is just getting set,” Pep explained. “It tries to stop you from setting a clear goal. It’s mucky and makes your goal feel hazy and hard to achieve.”
“Aw, nerts!” whispered Marsh, worrying about Dax.

“Then there's the Distractor,” Pep continued. “Its tactic is to lure you away from your goal.”
“This gremlin will try to tempt you with all kinds of distractions.”
“Sneaky!” Marsh squeaked.

“The Swarm of Excuses is the peskiest gremlin,” Pep went on.
“It can descend on you with all kinds of reasons why you won’t be able to reach your goal.”
“This gremlin wants to frustrate you. Even worse, it can chip away at your self-confidence.”
“Annoying!” muttered Marsh.

“Next, watch out for the Procrastinator,” said Pep.
“Procrasta-what?“ asked Marsh.
Pep described a sly, charming gremlin that wants goal-setters to think they have all the time in the world.
“It will try to delay you from working towards your goal!” warned Pep.

“Finally, there’s the creepiest gremlin of all: Vampiro,” Pep whispered.
“Double nerts.” Marsh whimpered.
“It doesn't drink blood,” said Pep quickly. “But Vampiro tries to drain your motivation for your goal. It wants you to stop thinking about why your goal matters.”

“Pep, we can't let these gremlins ruin Dax's goal. Or she’ll never reach her Olympic dream!“ Marsh said as they set off to find their friend.<hr/>By the time they reached Dax, she was surrounded. “This is more serious than I thought,” said Pep. “Dax’s goal means so much to her, it’s made these gremlins extra greedy.”<hr/>“Courage!” cried Marsh. “It's time to start gremlin-busting!”

Mission: Facing Big Challenges
Pick the key goal-setting step:
Pick the same goal as your friend
Hmm...you might not always have the same goals as your friend.
Choose a clear and realistic goal
Yep! Challenge yourself within your limits.
Just start doing something and pick your goal later
Hmm...don't think that's the best way to set a goal.
Pick a goal that will make you famous
Hmm...not sure that's key to goal setting.
Pick the key goal-setting step:
Decide on a finish line for your goal
Exactly! Pick a timeframe to aim for.
It’s better not to give your goal a finish line
Hmm...pretty sure a finish line is an important step.
Once you set a finish line you can’t change it
Hmm...most of the time your finish line can change.
Always set your finish line on a special occasion
Hmm...not always—it depends on your goal.
Pick the key goal-setting step:
Don't make a plan to reach your goal
Hmm...pretty sure every goal needs a plan.
Break your goal down into smaller steps
Right! Breaking your goal into steps gives you a plan.
Complete your goal as quickly as possible
Hmm...some goals need more time to complete than others.
Skip over any steps that are too hard
Hmm...skipping a hard step won't get you closer to your goal.
Pick the key goal-setting step:
Think about why your goal matters to your teacher
Hmm...not all your goals will concern your teacher.
Dwell on all the ways you could fail to reach your goal
Hmm...don't think this would be a useful action.
Reflect on why your goal matters to you
That’s it! This will help you stay motivated along the way.
Don’t think about your goal, it’s bad luck
Hmm...not sure luck matters here.
Here are some key goal-setting steps:
Clean sweep!
Dax scrubbed the Muddler by getting clear on her goal: to learn to do a perfect cartwheel.

Mission: Facing Big Challenges
The Distractor is closing in! What could distract someone from reading 1 chapter book in a month?
Goal: Reading 1 chapter book in a month
Distractor:
Starting a new video game
Got it! Might be too tempting to spend time playing instead of reading.
Setting aside a certain time to read each day
Hmm...this sounds like a good plan, not a distraction.
Planning to read at least 5 pages a day
Hmm...pretty sure this is a good idea and not a distraction.
Reading with a friend 2 days a week
Hmm...seems like this could be one way to reach that goal.
It’s the Swarm of Excuses! What poor excuse could stop someone from practicing tennis 3 times a week?
Goal: Practicing tennis 3 times a week
Swarm of Excuses:
The tennis court is closed for repairs
Hmm...sounds like something you can't control—not a poor excuse.
I sprained my ankle so I should rest until I feel better
Hmm...that's a good reason to take a break.
There’s no point in practicing at all unless I practice every day
Yep! 3 practices a week is way better than none.
There's a class trip today so I’ll practice on the weekend instead
Hmm...sounds like a wise plan rather than a poor excuse.
Here comes the Procrastinator! What could keep someone from leaving for school on time?
Goal: Leave for school on time
Procrastinator:
Pack their school bag before bed
Hmm...pretty sure that would help leaving for school on time.
Watch just 1 more cartoon episode
You bet! The extra screen time can lead to being late.
Get out of bed as soon as they wake up
Hmm...pretty sure that would help someone leave on time.
Wait until after school to get out the Lego
Hmm...sounds like a good idea if they want to leave on time.
STEP UP!
Now help Dax defeat the gremlins and keep her goal on track!
Dax needs to practice. Pick 2 ways Dax can defeat the Distractor
2 ways Dax can defeat the Distractor
Her goal must not truly matter if she gets distracted
Hmm...distractions can get in the way of all goals.
Stay away from distracting things while she cartwheels
Excellent move!
Set a certain time to work on cartwheels and take short breaks
Right on! Short breaks can help Dax focus without distractions.
Give in to the distraction so it stops bothering her
Hmm...pretty sure that's letting the Distractor win.
Pick 2 ways Dax can stop the Swarm of Excuses from pulling her off track
2 ways Dax can stop the Swarm of Excuses from pulling her off track
Ignore the excuses and do her cartwheel practice
Great idea! Most excuses will fade away without the attention.
Wear earmuffs so she can’t hear the excuses
Hmm...pretty sure earmuffs will only help keep her ears warm.
Listen to the excuses and give up on cartwheeling
Hmm...pretty sure that's letting the Swarm of Excuses win.
Think about her Olympic dream to drown out any excuses
Nice plan! Thinking of her long-term goal is an excuse-buster.
Pick 2 ways that Dax can outsmart the Procrastinator and meet her goal on time.
2 ways that Dax can face down the Procrastinator
Plan to skip cartwheeling today but do extra the next time
Hmm...skipping practice for no reason can pull Dax's goal off track.
Keep track of each practice, like with a sticker on a calendar
Fantastic! Seeing her progress, she won’t want to skip practice.
If she puts it off today, her cartwheels will be better tomorrow
Hmm...don't think her cartwheels will get better without practice.
Plan to cartwheel at a certain time, like right after lunch
Yes! That’s a good way to stay on track and beat procrastination.
Success!
Dax shook off those pesky gremlins and made some good progress.
Here are some obstacles to goals and ways to overcome them:
Goal Gazing
Don’t let Vampiro steal Dax’s will to ‘wheel!
Don’t let Vampiro steal Dax’s will to ‘wheel!

Here are some goals to help certain dreams come true:
Dreamy!
You and Dax are ready to shine at goal setting and getting.
Treble
Atlas
Chip
Dart
Newt

“Way to battle those sneaky gremlins!” gushed Marsh, as he gave Dax a high five.<hr/>“They were a sneaky bunch.” Dax agreed. “Thanks for the help fending them off. It’s weird but I think my cartwheels got better after all that!”<hr/>“Maybe facing gremlins makes you stronger,” Marsh’s eyes grew wide, “like when you eat spinach! Maybe gremlins are spinach for goals?!”

“One thing’s for sure,” Pep assured Dax, “if those gremlins show up again, you’ll know how to tackle them.”<hr/>“My stomach’s growling. Let's go for smoothies,” Dax suggested. “Oh! And I can pick up my scary story where I left off.”<hr/>“No thanks!” said Marsh quickly, still recovering from the gremlin invasion. “How about a funny story, instead? One with lots of cute bunnies and kittens.”
You did it!
